intro: Amphilophis erianthoides, commonly known as the woolly amphilophis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the spring. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
